texts: Monkey is a common name that may refer to groups or species ofmammals, in part, the simians of infraorder Simiiformes. The term isapplied descriptively to groups of primates, such as families of NewWorld monkeys and Old World monkeys. Many monkey species aretree-dwelling (arboreal), although there are species that liveprimarily on the ground, such as baboons. Most species are alsoactive during the day (diurnal). Monkeys are generally considered to be intelligent, especially the Old World monkeys of Catarrhini.
